image.altText: A man with short greying hair in a navy suit and tie stands on a patch of grass looking serious.

props.synopsis: A fortnight after two St Edmund's College students were hit by an alleged stolen car on a median strip outside their school, principal Tim Cleary says "common sense" changes like a 40kph school zone must be made.

title.children: 'Common sense': Principal calls for 40kph zone after boys hit by car

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu 2025-04-11 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals Senate candidate Jacob Vadakkedathu says "there will be voluntary redundancies" as part of a plan to cut public service jobs.

title.children: Canberra Liberals candidate says no forced redundancies in public cuts plan

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Angus Ross Robertson, 24, was charged with two counts of rape and two acts of indecency on the woman, who was a fellow cadet.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping fellow ADFA cadet

image.altText: A man with short black hair sits in a museum in front of a glass artwork depicting cabbage leaves on a wall.

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

image.altText: Commonwealth park floriade

props.synopsis: The decision-makers behind Canberra's Parliamentary Triangle are sharing their ideas for the future of Commonwealth Park, but they want more input.

title.children: More flowers, a lakeside swimming pool and a Ferris wheel on the cards for Commonwealth Park

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man is sentenced to nearly seven years jail after pleading guilty to five counts of aggravated rape, one act of indecency and a threat to kill committed against a 14-year-old girl over five days.

title.children: Man jailed for raping 14-year-old, threatening to kill her with machete

image.altText: A small white fluffy glider with prominent ears, wide eyes and a little button nose peeks out of hole in a tree at night

props.synopsis: The South East Forest Rescue group alleged the Forestry Corporation of NSW did not conduct a broad area habitat search for features of habitat for three species of glider in areas of native forest logging in NSW.

title.children: High Court verdict provides 'hope amid an escalating extinction crisis'

props.synopsis: Australian grain-fed beef exports to China are surging as the trade war with the US escalates, but some are warning of a bigger, more worrying picture.

title.children: Trump-China tariffs beef halts US trade — and Australia steps in

image.altText: A man holds a blue can with an American flag on it

props.synopsis: On-again-off-again tariffs and an intensifying trade war with China are taking their toll on ordinary Americans in a range of ways.

title.children: 'Freezing us': American businesses paralysed in evolving trade war

image.altText: Group of people walking across a bridge.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton have both started their day in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Parties try to woo the West ahead of key campaign launches

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Electric ferries to part of Metronet': WA premier
Anthony Albanese is speaking in Perth
Albanese, Roger Cook to spruik Perth ferry expansion

image.altText: A woman wearing blue scrubs has her arm around an older woman wearing a pink cardigan as they walk across a lush green lawn.

props.synopsis: Senior Australians wanting to stay living at home independently for longer have concerns about new, national charges for services such as showering, cleaning and gardening; and how the co-payments will affect them.

title.children: 'Dismal, pathetic, horrific': Older Australians brace to pay more for home care

image.altText: Elon Musk and Donald Trump embrace on a red stage.

props.synopsis: Shawn Monper, 32, is accused of threatening to kill US President Donald Trump, his billionaire ally Elon Musk and top government officials and agents in several comments he made online.

title.children: 'We need to start killing people': Man threatened Trump and Musk, US says

image.altText: An aerial shot of sandy desert meeting an inland lake with blue skies.

props.synopsis: The deluge which battered south-west Queensland is now draining downhill to a catchment area five times the size of the UK.

title.children: The barren wasteland about to transform into Australia's largest lake

image.altText: Jodie and Adam Knell - pls blur baby's face (2)

props.synopsis: Former members of strict religious groups have told the ABC about their loved ones shunning them after they left, breaking their families apart.

title.children: Jodie and Adam were happy in their church community — then came the split

image.altText: A woman holds a box of fruit and vegetables.

props.synopsis: In some parts of Far North Queensland, paying $3 a litre for fuel is just a fact of life. But the retirement of one of the nation's longest serving MPs has Labor thinking it can win the vast seat of Leichhardt for the first time in almost 20 years.

title.children: Election battleground in the tropics where cost of living is soaring

image.altText: A woman wearing a red blazer is talking with shadows in front of her

props.synopsis: Until the last election, the electorate of Boothby hadn't been in the hands of a Labor candidate since 1949 — but the ALP's Louise Miller-Frost broke that streak by winning the seat, and is now taking another tilt.

title.children: Labor won Boothby for the first time in 73 years — can it hold it?

image.altText: a man wearing a t-shirt and a cap with a bull on it

props.synopsis: A US federal judge has rebuked a government lawyer who has been unable explain what the Trump administration had done to arrange for the return of a father who has been mistakenly deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador.

title.children: White House ordered to reveal plans to return man wrongly deported to El Salvador prison

image.altText: A black-and-white photo shows a woman with shoulder-length dark hair smiling while holding a smiling child

props.synopsis: Maria Voulgaris has this grainy image to remind her of her mother, who is behind bars for a crime she says she didn't knowingly commit.

title.children: 'Oceans away': Daughter of convicted drug smuggler speaks about her pain

image.altText: Image of a collection of purple carrots and plums.

props.synopsis: A plum bred in Queensland is showing promise in the fight against dementia. Australian researchers are testing whether an extract from the fruit can boost brain health.

title.children: Could a plum grown in Queensland help prevent dementia? Scientists hope so

image.altText: People jump off rocky coastline into water.

props.synopsis: Four of Western Australia's last five fatal great white shark attacks have occurred in a remote tourist hotspot. Locals worry the tragic recent history will continue.

title.children: Growing calls for action after tourist region's latest fatal shark attack

image.altText: Nyadol Nyuon looks at the camera seriously.

props.synopsis: A high-profile lawyer asked to oversee the delivery of a $800,000 Victorian workplace safety project says she left early, after it instead left her feeling "victimised" in her own job.

title.children: Lawyer says project to protect women at work ended in 'perfect failure'

image.altText: Man on a boat wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A Queensland jury has found a Hervey Bay landlord guilty of manslaughter over the death of his 62-year-old tenant Craig Dunn at an industrial building complex.

title.children: Landlord found guilty of manslaughter after tenant died with multiple injuries

image.altText: A close up of a baby in white muslin wrap with stars on it, being held by two adults. No faces are visible.

props.synopsis: While experts say this case is "unprecedented" in Australia, it's happened multiple times in the US, as far back as 1999.

title.children: 'Human error' to blame for Monash IVF embryo mix-up — could it happen again?

image.altText: Three female faces of candidates for Richmond, NSW in teal coloured circles over a map.

props.synopsis: Labor has held the seat of Richmond for 20 years and it was Nationals heartland before that. Now the Greens are in a tight mix as the NSW North Coast electorate heads to the polls.

title.children: Comedian, ex-cop and business coach in 'three-horse' race for Richmond

image.altText: Adam Scott plays a shot in the sand

props.synopsis: Adam Scott is one of several Australians to have a day to forget in Augusta as Rory McIlroy roars into contention.

title.children: Scott records unwanted 16-year first in horror Masters day for Australians

image.altText: Generic flu, influenza, cold, sniffle shot.

props.synopsis: The earlier than normal arrival of this year's flu season has doctors urging Australians to roll up their sleeves to get vaccinated.

title.children: The best time to get a flu shot for expected 'severe' season

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a t-shirt depicting Clinton Austin.

props.synopsis: A coroner is told Indigenous man Clinton Austin waited more than two years for NDIS support prior to being found unresponsive in his jail cell.

title.children: First Nations man died in prison after waiting years for disability support, inquest told

image.altText: The Bureau of Meteorology's tropical cyclone track map which projects tropical low 29U to form into a cyclone as early as Saturd

props.synopsis: Preparations in Western Australia's north are underway, with a tropical cyclone likely to form off the state's northern coast today.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Errol could intensify to category three over Kimberley

image.altText: French stands on a stage, looking off-camera.

props.synopsis: Former Chief Justice of Australia's High Court Robert French has become the latest foreign judge to quit Hong Kong's highest court.

title.children: Australian judge quits Hong Kong Court of Appeal

image.altText: Steve Witkoff

props.synopsis: Steve Witkoff is expected to sit down with the Russian President amid tensions between the US and Moscow's allies China and Iran.

title.children: US envoy set to meet Putin as Trump tells Moscow to 'get moving' on Ukraine

image.altText: A woman wearing military clothes speaks to three people

props.synopsis: The head of the US military base in Greenland fired for criticising Washington's agenda for the Arctic island.

title.children: Head of US base in Greenland fired after JD Vance visit

image.altText: Alex de Minaur waves to the crowd with his left hand

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur showcases his ruthless streak in a comprehensive straight-sets win over Grigor Dimitrov to book a spot in the semifinals of the Monte Carlo Masters.

title.children: 'Pretty crazy': De Minaur records career-first to advance to Monte Carlo semis

image.altText: The Doctor and Belinda smile at something offscreen, standing in front of the Tardis.

props.synopsis: Ncuti Gatwa and his new companion Varada Sethu on being back in the TARDIS for a brand new season of Disney's Doctor Who rebrand.

title.children: Meet the first Doctor Who companion to live in a crappy share house

image.altText: Dark grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO and Wine Australia are trialling fast-growing, mildew-resistant grapevines designed to maintain yield and wine quality in a changing climate.

title.children: Tiny vines could hold the key to a future-proof wine industry
